title: Create Variables
text: Let $$h$$ represent the husband's earnings and w represent the wife's earning.
speech: Let  h  represent the husband's earnings and w represent the wife's earning.
pacedSpeech: represent the husband's earnings and w represent the wife's earning.

title: Translate Into System
text: Together they earn $110,000 translating into $$h+w=110000$$. The wife earns $16,000 less than twice her husband translating into $$w=2h-16000$$.
speech: Together they earn $110,000 translating into  h plus w, is equal to, 110000 . The wife earns $16,000 less than twice her husband translating into  w, is equal to, 2 h minus 16000 .
pacedSpeech: Together they earn $110,000 translating into   h plus w, is equal to, 110000
. The wife earns $16,000 less than twice her husband translating into   w, is equal to, 2 h minus 16000

title: Solve the System
text:
Using substitution we can substitute $$w=2h-16000$$ into $$h+w=110000$$ to solve for $$h$$, the husband's earnings.
$$h+w=110000$$
$$h+2h-16000=110000$$
$$3h-16000=110000$$
$$3h=126000$$
speech:
Using substitution we can substitute  w is equal to 2 h minus 16000  into  h, plus w is equal to, 110000  to solve for  h , the husband's earnings.
 h plus w is equal to 110000 
 h, plus 2 h minus 16000 is equal to, 110000 
 3 h, minus 16000 is equal to, 110000 
 3 h is equal to 126000

title: Finding the Husband's Earnings
text: How much does the husband earn?
speech: How much does the husband earn?
